climbs.name: Water Slide
climbs.fa: Alex Barbella, Cameron Winston, Kelly Cordner  11/2018

content.description: Slab and off vertical face to ever steepening wide water course. Follow the rest of P1 of Middle Ground. Have you're belayer tie in. Rappel to the start of Middle Ground which is a 70 meter rope stretcher.
content.location: From the top of p1 Cougar's Path walk left along the ledge and then up the gulley. The route leaves the gulley on the left side.

content.description: Off vertical face and slab. An ostensibly easy ramp leads to the crux which is followed by several 11a slab moves.
Follow a dike past an overlap until the bolt line goes up left over friction slab with several mantle type moves.  Several 5.9 cruxes above the dike.
content.protection: 15 bolts. Chain anchors. You need a 70 m rope for the 125 ft. rappel.  Have belayer tie in.  You cannot lower to the ground when the rope is running through the draws.
content.location: Scramble up and left from the top of Bobcat Track or Middle Ground.  Descend a class 3 ridge  to the intersection of gullies behind the Tear Drop.  The route is up the gulley about 150 feet.

content.description: Off vertical face, slab and seams.

Off vertical face, slab and water courses. P1, 5.8 is a long excellent pitch. The rappel from the top of p1 to the top of the gulley is a 70 m rope stretcher. P2 is 5.6 or 5.7 and ends at the top of the Tear Drop.
content.location: From p1 of Cougar's Patch walk left along the ledge and ascend gulley to it's top.

content.description: Follow an intermittent fracture/ dike. Then, up and left, mantle over a large dike and follow the bolt line over friction slabs.
content.protection: 16 Bolts.  Shares Chain anchors with Scuff N. Go.  120 ft. rapel. You need a 70 meter rope for the rappel!  Have belayer tie in because you can not lower back to the ground when rope is running through the draws..  Crux is at the 2nd to last bolt.
content.location: The start is right of and down from Scuff N' Go.

content.description: p1. 5.7  crux at blt 1   p2 5.9-  crux above last bolt.   p3. 5.8
content.protection: bolts, chain draws, 70 meter rope. p.2 is a 70 meter rope stretcher on rappel.
content.location: Right side of the gulley that splits the Tear Drop

content.description: Off vertical face and slab. Part way up My Big Horn follow a dark traversing slab to the right. This ends up at the anchors for Sphincter Shrinker.
3 pitch route.  Fun easy climbing follows water courses, beautiful dykes and a fracture system for part of the last pitch.
content.protection: p1 5 bolts. 65 ft.      p2 36 meters 10 bolts.    p3  35 meters 5 bolts.   p2 is the crux.   chain anchors on all pitches.  you need a 70 meter rope!
content.location: south west facing slab on left side of the tear drop formation.
